intro: Brodiaea recurvifolia, commonly known as the recurved brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing pale yellow to white flowers that are often tinged with pink. Brodiaea recurvifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and drought tolerance.
